chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
items.plainText: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

items.text: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
items.plainText: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

items.text: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
items.plainText: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

items.text: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
items.plainText: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

items.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
items.plainText: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

items.text: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
items.plainText: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

items.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
items.plainText: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

items.text: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
items.plainText: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

items.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
items.plainText: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

items.text: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
items.plainText: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

items.text: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
items.plainText: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

items.text: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
items.plainText: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

items.text: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
items.plainText: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

items.text: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
items.plainText: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

items.text: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
items.plainText: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

items.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
items.plainText: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

items.text: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
items.plainText: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

items.text: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
items.plainText: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

items.text: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
items.plainText: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

items.text: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
items.plainText: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

items.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
items.plainText: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

items.text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
items.plainText: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
